subject: Leadership
title: Moats and Defensibility
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Moats and Defensibility.

hook.text: Buffett only invests in companies with moatsâ€”structural advantages that keep competitors out. What creates a moat?

buildup.text: Moats include brand loyalty, network effects, switching costs, scale economies, and proprietary technology or data.

discovery.text: Google's moat is data: more users create better search, which attracts more users. The cycle compounds relentlessly.

twist.text: Moats erode. Kodak had brand and scale. Technology dissolved both. Leaders must continuously widen their moats.

climax.text: Strategic leaders ask: what makes us hard to replace? If the answer is unclear, building defensibility is urgent.

punchline.text: A business without a moat is a business waiting to be copied.

quiz.question: What is a strategic moat?
options: A structural advantage that keeps competitors out
